hotspots.hotspot:
Proton

  • It has mass.
  • Its mass is extremely small.
  • Its mass is 1 atomic mass unit, or 1 amu.
  • Its charge is commonly written as +1.

Neutron

  • It has the same mass as a proton.
  • It is a neutral particle.
  • It does not have a charge.

Electron

  • It is assigned a mass of 0.
  • Its charge is commonly written as â€“1.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: 1. This nucleus has 8 protons and 8 neutrons.
2. This atom is known as deuterium and contains only 1 proton and 1 neutron.
3. Inside this nucleus are 8 neutrons, and 8 electrons orbit them.
4. This atom is known as tritium and contains 1 proton and 2 neutrons.

multiple.question:
What type of ion is this Magnesium ion?

12 (+) + 11 (-) = 1 (+)

multiple.question: Isotopes have the same number of protons, but a different number of neutrons.
The three parts that make up an atom are protons, neutrons, and ions.
A neutron is the smallest unit of an element that still maintains the properties of that element.
A radioisotope is an unstable isotope.
Molecules are made up of elements.
An atom has 13 protons and 13 neutrons. An isotope of this element must have
All copper atoms have 29 protons. Some copper ions have a +2 charge. How many electrons do these ions have?
A radioisotope of carbon has 6 protons and 8 neutrons. Which statement is correct about this isotope?

answers.answer: This isotope has 14 positive charges in its nucleus.

multiple.question: The nucleus of an atom is composed of which of the following particles?
